structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en: The course contains both theoretical and emphasised practical approaches to project writing.
description.et: Kursus koosneb nii teoreetilisest kui ka praktilisest osas (rõhuga viimasel).

objectives.en: The course aims to develop skills for finding relevant funding program,  writing project application, implementing the project and reporting. During the course, students are advised to pay attention to different aspects of project management regarding project design, planning, implementation, and reporting.
objectives.et: Kursus on mõeldud selleks, et arendada oskusi sobiva rahastuprogrammi leidmiseks, projektitaotluse kirjutamiseks ning selle teostamiseks ja aruandluseks.

independent_work.et:
Participants will be responsible for reading approximately 20 - 30 pages in preparation for each class. Listed readings for each class should be done before class as it will be discussed at the seminars.
There are 6 practical assignments in total, all related to reading materials and topics covered in the class. Homeworks are essential part of the final assignment.

Homework no 1: Quiz on terminology
Please read the materials and make yourself familiar with the terminology. Then complete the quiz. Due 7 October 2018.

Homework no 2: Funding programmes database
Find an appropriate funding programme that suits your idea, make yourself familiar with the funding conditions, guidelines and project application form. Please create an entry with the respective information related to the funding programme you would like to work with. Due 4 October 2018.

Homework no 3: LogFrame Assignment
Submit a single file with the LogFrame. Due 14 October 2018.

Homework no 4: WP Assignment
Please fill in three-level WP and submit a single file per group. Due 4 November 2018.

Homework no 5: project budget Assignment
Read the materials and learn what the project budget is. Fill in the project budget table and submit it as a single file here. Due 18 November 2018.

Final assingment: Project proposal
Complete the project application form and submit as a single file. Please upload you project application to Moodle due 2 December 2018. Be ready to present the project in the class on 9 December 2018.

grade_preconditions.et: The presentation of the project design and final written submission is essential for the final grading. All homeworks assessed on non-differentiated scale (pass/fail)

grade_evaluation.et: Students will be divided into project teams to write a project proposal (design the implementation scenario). The final submission of the projects, orally and in written, is expected. All homeworks assessed on non-differentiated scale (pass/fail).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Participants will be responsible for reading approximately 20 - 30 pages in preparation for each class.  

* Heagney, Joseph (2012). Fundamentals of Project Management. Saranac Lake, NY, USA: AMACOM.
* Morris, Peter, Pinto, Jeffrey, Söderlund, Jonas (eds.) (2011). The Oxford Handbook of Project Management.
* Gagné, M.,  Panaccio, A (2014) The Motivational Power of Job Design. In The Oxford Handbook of Work Engagement, Motivation, and Self-Determination
* etc.
resources.recommended_materials: Other materials will be assigned during the course.

description.et:
Overview of the course, team building. Introduction to management: process, learning, people, self. Working in teams and defining roles. 
Principles of project management (how to start, what to achieve, where to go).
Principles of project management (continues). Funding possibilities.
EU funding programmes. Strategic planning. Stakeholder analysis. Problem tree and LogFrame.
Project communication, impact and dissemination. Evaluation principles.
Project monitoring, evaluation & reporting. Case studies analysis.

audience.et: Euroopa õpingute magistrandid, kohalike omavalitsuste juhid ja töötajad, avaliku sektori esindajad
